body_html:
No, it wasn't either. Turns out the benefit of downgrading was that I uninstalled scipy, not that I downgraded numpy.

With judicious pdb.set_trace()'s, I've determined:

  1. tensorflow imports tensorflow.contrib.learn
  2. tf.c.learn tries to load scikit-learn
  3. scikit-learn loads scipy.special for some optimization functions
  4. scipy.special loads a f2py module scipy.special.specfun
  5. scipy.special.specfun calls import_array, but after tensorflow has already

scipy.special.specfun calls import_array, but after tensorflow has already
body:
No, it wasn't either. Turns out the benefit of downgrading was that I uninstalled scipy, not that I downgraded numpy.

With judicious pdb.set_trace()'s, I've determined:
1. tensorflow imports tensorflow.contrib.learn
2. tf.c.learn tries to load scikit-learn
3. scikit-learn loads scipy.special for some optimization functions
4. scipy.special loads a f2py module scipy.special.specfun
5. scipy.special.specfun calls import_array, but _after_ tensorflow has already
